meanings.definition: In a manner that serves as an introduction or prelude.
meanings.sent1: She prelusively greeted each guest at the door before the party started.
meanings.sent2: The musician played prelusively before the main performance.
meanings.sent3: The cat prelusively pawed at the door, eager to explore the new room.
meanings.sent4: The sun rose prelusively over the horizon, signaling the start of a new day.
meanings.sent5: The teacher prelusively explained the upcoming lesson to the students.

meanings.definition: Acting as a preliminary or introductory step.
meanings.sent1: The prelusively prepared ingredients made cooking dinner easier.
meanings.sent2: The prelusively written outline helped organize the essay effectively.
meanings.sent3: The prelusively folded paper airplane flew surprisingly well.
meanings.sent4: Her prelusively planned route avoided traffic delays.
meanings.sent5: The prelusively chosen colors blended harmoniously in the painting.
